subject: Education
title: Nutrition and the Brain: You Are What You Eat
description: A 60-second lesson on Nutrition and the Brain: You Are What You Eat.

hook.text: Malnourished children in the first 1,000 days of life lose an average of 15 IQ points permanently. Hunger shrinks

buildup.text: The developing brain consumes 60% of an infant's calories. It needs iron, zinc, omega-3s, and protein to build synapses.

discovery.text: School lunch programs boost test scores by 4-8%. Hungry children can't concentrate, remember, or learn effectively.

twist.text: Malnutrition doesn't just affect the poor. Junk food diets in wealthy nations cause similar cognitive deficits.

climax.text: Feeding children properly is the cheapest and most effective education intervention ever discovered. Food is a learning

punchline.text: The most powerful school supply isn't a textbook. It's breakfast.

quiz.question: How does nutrition affect children's learning?
options: Malnutrition can permanently reduce IQ and cognitive ability
